page.title: 15AN ELDERLY PERSON, THORALBY
page.content: Mary is a pensioner who has lived in Bishopdale almost all her life. She was married to a farmer in 1933 and went to live in a remote farmhouse, Gayle Ing, outside Thoralby. She moved into her present home in 1955 and has lived there alone since her husband died in 1969. Mary has two daughters and four grandchildren who all live in the village. She lives next door to one daughter and her family. Mary cannot drive and she walks everywhere if possible. There is no bus service so that she has to depend on lifts from her family to go any distance. She can get most things and her pension from the local Post Office. She says it would be worrying for elderly people if the Post Office were to close.
